poem:
**Future Echoes**

In halls of parliament,  
voices murmur, a tapestry—  
laments of ministers,  
foreign ties bound by years,  
builders of health,  
brick by brick  
repairing windswept walls.  
Yet out there, a man  
bets on dreams  
or never-dreams, while cities  
balance on the edge  
of whispered probabilities,  
and I  
trace echoes in morning shadows.
